item.title: Fly tipping, dog fouling, unclean street on Glenister Road, 16th January
item.description:
There have been repeated incidents of fly-tipping, including clothes scattered across the street, black refuse bags left on the pavement, and broken household items dumped near the roadside. Although the rubbish is sometimes cleared, it is quickly replaced by further fly-tipped waste, making this an ongoing and persistent issue. In addition to this, there is a significant problem with dog fouling on the pavements. Dog mess is frequently left uncleared, making the pavements unhygienic and unsafe to use. As a result, the road often becomes the only suitable place to walk, which presents obvious safety risks. The street is clearly not being adequately cleaned or cared for. Overflowing bins, loose rubbish, fly-tipped items, and dog fouling are regularly left for extended periods, creating an unpleasant environment for residents. These conditions cause particular difficulty for disabled residents and for people using prams or pushchairs. Obstructed and dirty pavements force people into the road or make passage impossible, raising serious accessibility and safety concerns. I ask that this matter be investigated urgently, with improved street cleaning, enforcement action to address fly-tipping and dog fouling, and preventative measures put in place to stop these issues from continuing.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Caletock Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked drain (drain 3 of 3, 16th January
item.description:

item.title: The lights need to be removed!!, 16th January
item.description:
The works on the pavement finsihed early yesterday but the light remain there for no reason, it is causing chaos and serious congestion on all surrounding roads. We spoke to a worker on the scene who advised hes been waiting in his car for nearly 8 hours for them to be collected.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, West End Lane, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
